title.narrative: Support to Host Communities Affected by the Syrian Refugee Crisis in Jordan

description.narrative: Mercy Corps will build upon its successful models of community-based water resource management, participatory decision-making and conflict management to promote peaceful co-existence and address water and sanitation needs in host communities affected by the Syrian refugee crisis. The project will contribute to the following objectives and outcomes: Objective 1: Peaceful coexistence with local communities promoted Output: Projects benefiting local and displaced communities implemented Indicators: # of local community members benefiting from projects # of projects benefiting local and displaced communities implemented Objective 2: Supply of potable water increased or maintained Output: Water systems constructed, expanded and/or upgraded Indicators: # of persons served by water systems Objective 3: Population lives in satisfactory conditions of sanitation and hygiene Output: Sanitary facilities/ latrines in schools constructed Indicators: # of sanitary facilities/ latrines constructed in schools

The proposed project’s goal is to promote peaceful co-existence and address water needs in host communities affected by the Syrian refugee crisis The proposed project meets the following UNHCR objectives and outputs: 1 Peaceful co-existence with local communities promoted 1.1 Projects benefiting host and displaced communities implemented 2 Supply of potable water increased or maintained 2.1 Water system constructed, expanded and/or upgraded 3 Operations management, coordination & support strengthened & optimized 3.1 General project management services provided 2.
